page.title: 15SETTLEMENT..COLLESSIE villg.
page.content: Collessie situated about 10 km. from Cupar has been a settlement site since Bronze Age. The history of the village is borne out by the numerous old cottages, some still with thatched roofs. These small cottages are set in very attractive surroundings and are in an excellent state of repair. The building materials are a mixture of sandstone and local whinstone since Collessie lies on a geological boundary between these two rock types. The older housing mixes well with three modern bungalows which have been built using brick and harling. The amenities in the village are very limited with only 1 telephone box, 1 post box and a village hall. Collessie church which stands at the centre of the village is built of local sandstone and it sits prominently on a mound surrounded by an old graveyard.
